text: The aim of indigenization policy was to

options.A: build more industries in the economy
options.B: increase the drain in foreign exchange
options.C: increase foreign domination of the economy
options.D: increase the participation of Nigerians in commerce and industry
options.E: send all the foreigners away from Nigeria

explanation: Indigenization is the transfer of ownership and control of business enterprises from foreigners to indigenes. It is aimed at increasing the participation of indigenes in commercial activities while reducing the presence of foreign players.

text: According to the theory of comparative advantages, countries are to specialize based on their
explanation:
Thetheory of comparative advantagestates that if countries specialise in producing goods where they have a lower opportunitycost– then there will be an increase in economic welfare.
The law of comparative advantage describes how, under free trade, an agent will produce more of and consume less of a good for which they have a comparative advantage.

text: Which of the following is NOT a reason for the absence of an industry in the rural areas?
explanation:
External economies of scale are business-enhancing factors that happen outside a company but within the same industry. It has to do with the availability of skilled labor, banking facilities, transportation, communication, etc within a company.
Option E  is the correct option because rural areas lack most of the things that make up a company's external economies of scale.

Which of these is NOT a basic economic problem of society?
explanation:
Scarcity, or limited resources, is one of the most basic economic problems we face. We run into scarcity because while resources are limited, we are a society with unlimited wants. The problem of
- what to produce- how to produce and for- whom to produce are the basic economic problems of a society.- Efficiency of resources used
Scale of production is a secondary production function.

options.A: growth in a nation’s life expectancy
options.C: rate of increase in aggregate demand in a country
options.D: rate of increase in a country’s full employment and real output

text: In the demographic transition theory, stage II represents a stage where

options.A: declining birth rates with low death rates lead to little or no population growth
options.B: high birth rate with low death rates lead to no population growth
options.C: there is population growth due to high birth rates and low death rates at that stages
options.D: there is a slow rate of population growth as a result of high birth rate accompanied by high but slightly fluctuating death rate
options.E: there is a very high growth as population as a result of high birth rates accompanied by high but slightly fluctuating death rates

text: Which of the following is NOT a factor determining supply?
explanation:
Supply will be determined by factors such as- price,- the number of suppliers,- the state of technology,- government subsidies,- weather conditions and- the availability of workers to produce the good.
The income of the producer doesn't affect supply.
